summary: This document contains various aircraft registration applications and bills of sale related to the Keystone Helicopter S-76C. It includes details about ownership transfers, registration numbers, and associated legal requirements. The document is significant for tracking the ownership and registration history of the aircraft involved in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Richard Munkvold
persons.context: Richard Munkvold is identified as the CFO of Frontier Finance Co, who digitally signed an aircraft registration application.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Larry Visoski is mentioned as the manager who signed a bill of sale for the aircraft.

persons.name: James D. Clark
persons.role: Senior Vice President, Controller & Chief Accounting Officer
persons.context: James D. Clark is identified as the Senior Vice President who signed a bill of sale for the aircraft.

persons.name: Brandt S. Sterling
persons.context: Brandt S. Sterling is mentioned as a legal assistant who requested a duplicate certificate of registration for the aircraft.

persons.name: Walter L. Binkley
persons.context: Walter L. Binkley is mentioned as the manager who communicated about the status of registration number changes.

persons.name: Shaun M. Gabbard
persons.context: Shaun M. Gabbard is mentioned as the supervisor who requested corrections to the aircraft registration.

persons.name: David A. Ford
persons.context: David A. Ford is identified as the president of Keystone Helicopter Corporation who signed a bill of sale.

persons.name: Carl Kress
persons.context: Carl Kress is mentioned as the program manager who requested reservation assignments for special registration numbers.

connections.description: Richard Munkvold is the CFO of Frontier Finance Co.
Larry Visoski is the manager who signed documents on behalf of ASI Wings LLC.
James D. Clark is a senior executive who signed documents for ASI Wings LLC.
Brandt S. Sterling is a legal assistant representing ASI Wings LLC.
Walter L. Binkley is the manager at the FAA overseeing aircraft registrations.
Shaun M. Gabbard is a quality assurance supervisor at Keystone Helicopter Corporation.
David A. Ford is the president of Keystone Helicopter Corporation.
Carl Kress is the S76 program manager at Keystone Helicopter Corporation.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Application Signed
events.description: Richard Munkvold signed an aircraft registration application for a helicopter.

events.title: Bill of Sale for Aircraft
events.description: Larry Visoski signed a bill of sale for the aircraft transferring ownership.

events.title: Aircraft Sold
events.description: James D. Clark signed a bill of sale for the aircraft to ASI Wings LLC.

events.title: Request for Duplicate Certificate
events.description: Brandt S. Sterling requested a duplicate certificate of registration for the aircraft.

events.title: Cancellation of Special Registration Number
events.description: Walter L. Binkley communicated the cancellation of a special registration number for the aircraft.

events.title: Aircraft Sold
events.description: David A. Ford signed a bill of sale for the aircraft to Air Ghislaine, Inc.

events.title: Manufacturer's Registration Number Assigned
events.description: Walter L. Binkley confirmed the assignment of a registration number to Keystone Helicopter Corp.

keyFacts: Richard Munkvold signed an aircraft registration application on May 17, 2021.
Larry Visoski signed a bill of sale for the aircraft on May 13, 2021.
James D. Clark signed a bill of sale for the aircraft on June 13, 2019.
Brandt S. Sterling requested a duplicate certificate of registration on August 4, 2014.
Walter L. Binkley communicated the cancellation of a special registration number on December 11, 2012.
David A. Ford signed a bill of sale for the aircraft to Air Ghislaine, Inc. on December 30, 2008.
